content:
## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Coal Mining and Storage Facility at Position (x=53.0, y=-83.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (x=53.0, y=-83.0) extracting coal.
- Wooden Chest at position (x=52.5, y=-84.5) storing coal.
- Wooden Chest at position (x=54.5, y=-84.5) storing coal.

### Copper Ore Mining and Transport System at Position (x=-23.0, y=-68.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (x=-23.0, y=-68.0) extracting copper ore.
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-23.5, y=-69.5) storing copper ore.
- Transport Belt system connecting the mining drill to the chest.

### Iron Ore Mining and Processing Facility at Position (x=-14.0, y=-53.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (x=-14.0, y=-53.0) extracting iron ore.
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-14.5, y=-54.5) storing iron ore.
- Burner Inserter at position (x=-13.5, y=-54.5) transferring iron ore to a chest.
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-12.5, y=-54.5) storing iron ore and copper plate.

### Iron Plate Production Facility at Position (x=-21.0, y=-62.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Stone Furnace at position (x=-21.0, y=-62.0) smelting iron ore into iron plates.
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-20.5, y=-63.5) storing iron plates.

### Iron Ore and Plate Storage at Position (x=-16.5, y=-64.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-16.5, y=-64.5) storing iron ore and iron plates.
- Burner Inserter at position (x=-15.5, y=-64.5) transferring items between chests.
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-14.5, y=-64.5) storing items.

### Iron Ore and Plate Storage at Position (x=1.5, y=0.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Wooden Chest at position (x=1.5, y=0.5) storing iron ore and iron plates.
- Burner Inserter at position (x=2.5, y=0.5) transferring items between chests.
- Wooden Chest at position (x=3.5, y=0.5) storing items.

### Belt Systems
- Multiple Belt Groups connecting various entities for material transport, including positions such as (x=-25.5, y=-70.5) to (x=-23.5, y=-70.5) and others.

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors when placing entities without inventory
- Ensure you have the required entity in your inventory before attempting to place it. For example, attempting to place a wooden chest without having one in inventory resulted in an error.

### Errors when using extracting but being too far
- Make sure to move to the target entity where you want to extract from before extracting items.

### Errors when placing into a tile which is occupied by another entity
- Ensure you can place an entity to a tile before attempting placing.
